synopsis.text:
Shin Toutotsu ni Egypt transports us to the vibrant realm of ancient Egyptian deities, where the gods of yore, from the revered Anubis to the wise Thoth, reside in a world of their own. But this is no ordinary divine existence. Here, Bastet serenades with impromptu song and dance performances, while Medjed maintains an unwavering stoicism. Horus juggles a part-time job, Set finds joy in mischievous pranks, and Ra is a globetrotter who rarely returns home.

By day, these gods are dedicated to their divine duties, but when the sun sets, they indulge in a myriad of activities that add a touch of chaos to their otherwise orderly lives. Anubis, the god of death, even uses a child's seesaw to pass judgment!

"Oh, Suddenly Egyptian God" offers a delightful peek into the unconventional lives of these gods, where duty and fun coexist in a whimsical blend of the divine and the mundane. Join us in this unique journey and discover that, perhaps, the secret to life is finding joy in the most unexpected places.
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
